Description:
Excluding Notices of Acquisition, lodgement sequence numbers in the lodgement document summary must:
  •  start at 1, and
  •  be a continuous sequence incremented by 1, and
  •  be unique.
Each party reference must refer to a party in the involved parties element of its counterpart.
Each party reference for a mortgagor in a mortgage must be unique.
Each party reference for a mortgagee in a mortgage must be unique.
Each party reference for a mortgagee in a discharge of mortgage must be unique.
Each party reference for a party represented in an execution must be unique.
A cord holder consent must contain one consenting party.
A withdrawal of consent must contain one party relinquishing.

Jurisdictional data must conform to the NECDS interface specification for the following categories:
    •  Action Required
    •  Consent Type
    •  CT Direction
    •  Estate Type
    •  Fee Type
    •  Party Issued With Cord
    •  Requirement Action
    •  Issuing Party Direction
    •  Action Prohibited
    •  Estate or Interest Claimed
    •  Claim Category
    •  Claim Statement
    •  Consideration Type
    •  Encumbrance Type
    •  Municipality Name
    •  Primary Land Use
    •  Construction of Main Structure
    •  Supporting Document Type
    •  Legislation
A lodgement case request must pass header, schema & jurisdiction validations.\n \n*For rules, refer to Land Title Reference Verification Service Design
A mortgage must contain zero or one LrMemorandumID (MCP) data elements.
Each document in the lodgement case must have a unique ELN Document ID.
Parties in the lodgement case must not be party type ‘Indeterminate’.

For Mortgage instruments, each justification used in the lodgement case must:\n  •  contain one or more applicable title references, and\n  •  each applicable title reference must match a title reference in the instrument.
A nomination admin notice (CoRD Holder Consent structure) must include an LR Customer Code.
A withdrawal of nomination admin notice (Withdrawal of Consent structure) must include an LR Customer Code.
Within a lodgement case, each involved party element that has the same Party Id must also have the same Legal Entity Name.

For the lodgement instructions, if the Party Issued with CoRD element is populated with "Issuing Party", the Specified Party of Issue element must be populated with:\n  •  a Party Reference\n  •  an LR Customer Code

All supplied Bundle Subscription ID(s) must be valid.  Each one must:
  •  exist in VOTS
  •  be associated with a land title reference supplied
  •  match the network origin of the Bundle Subscription ID in VOTS
Each Party Identification Name value must be unique within an involved party element.
The total length of a mortgage reference element must be less than or equal to 20 characters long.
A nomination admin notice (CoRD Holder Consent structure) must contain a Consent Type element.
A CoRD Holder Consent structure must contain an Issuing Party Direction element.
Each justification used in the lodgement case must contain an Action Required element.
For a lodgement case containing instrument(s) which affect proprietorship or encumbrance(s), a valid Bundle Subscription ID must be supplied for each land title reference.
For each counterpart, the signature must be consistent with counterpart data and the signing certificate.
For each counterpart, the signature must be consistent with the text summary and the signing certificate.

For each counterpart, the text summary style sheet version must match the document style sheet version held by VOTS.\n \nThe correct document style sheet version is determined by the date / time of the first signature in the lodgement case.
For each counterpart, a text summary regenerated from the counterpart data must be consistent with the supplied text summary.
Each mortgagee provided in mortgage instrument data must have the Tenancy Type of "Mortgagee"
For each document, all common data used across counterpart text summaries must be consistent.\n \nCommon data for each text summary is defined in the solution design for text summaries.
Lodgement case fees must only include document fees.
If a lodgement fails pre-mapping message validation:\n  •  a message failure error must be returned, and\n  •  further processing must not take place.
The Lodgement Instructions must contain a lodgement instruction document type and counterpart data.

For each lodgement document, the document type and document content must match.  Lodgement documents must only contain the following document types:
   • Convert pCT to eCT and Nominate eCT to the Lodgement Case
   • Nominate eCT to the Lodgement Case
   • Nominate eCT to Paper Instrument
   • Withdrawal of Nomination
   • Discharge of Mortgage
   • Mortgage
   • Withdrawal of Caveat
   • Caveat
   • Transfer
   • Notice of Acquisition
The date / time of signature must fall within the validity period of the digital certificate.
Each lodgement document ID in the lodgement instructions must exist in the lodgement document(s).
Each lodgement document ID in the lodgement document(s) must exist in the lodgement instructions.
For the lodgement instructions, if the Set Of CoRD Issue Details element is provided, the CT Direction element must be populated.
A party of type 'Natural Person' or 'Sole Trader' must contain a Person Full Name element.
A structured street address must not contain a Lot element.
For a Change of Ownership, each Proprietor Holding party reference must be unique within a proprietor group element.
A Change of Ownership must contain zero or one Encumbrance element.
For a Change of Ownership, the Encumbrance Type must be MCP.

For a Change of Ownership, the Tenancy Type must be either:
   • Sole Proprietor, or
   • Joint Tenants, or
   • Tenants In Common.
For a Change of Ownership, the Service Of Notice Address for a Proprietor must be either:\n   • a structured street address, or\n   • an overseas address.
A Change of Ownership must contain exactly one Consideration element.
A Change of Ownership must contain exactly one Consideration Type.

For the following instruments:
  •  Discharge of Mortgage
  •  Withdrawal of Caveat
Each justification used in the lodgement case must:
  •  contain one or more Applicable LR Document IDs, and
  •  each Applicable LR Document ID must match an LR Document ID in the instrument.
For a Change of Ownership, if the Consideration Type is "Monetary", the Gross Consideration Amount must be greater than 0.
For a Change of Ownership, if the Consideration Type is not "Monetary", the Gross Consideration Amount must not be populated.

For the following instruments:
  •  Mortgage
  •  Change of Ownership
Each justification used must:
  •  contain one or more applicable title references, and
  •  each applicable title reference must match a title reference in the instrument.
A justification must only contain ONE of the following applicable reference types:\n  •  Applicable Title; OR\n  •  Applicable LR Document ID
Each party reference for a caveator in a withdrawal of caveat must be unique.
A Caveat must contain one Service of Notice Details element.
A Caveat Service Of Notice Address must be either:\n  •  a structured street address, or\n  •  an overseas address.
An overseas address must not contain more than 3 lines.
All address elements must conform to the maximum data lengths for the equivalent VOTS field type.

For a caveat, each party reference must be unique within the following elements:
  •  Party Receiving Details
  •  Registered Proprietors Affected
  •  Claim Party Details.
A Caveat must contain one Extent of Prohibition element.
The ELN Registry Instrument Reference element of a Notice Of Acquisition Vic must refer to the ELN Document ID of a Change of Ownership within the lodgement case.
Each party reference for a transferor in a Notice Of Acquisition Vic must be unique.
Each party reference for a transferee in a Notice Of Acquisition Vic must be unique.
An ELN Registry Instrument Reference in a Notice Of Acquisition Vic document must be unique within the lodgement case.

The ELN Document ID element of a Supporting Document containing an Evidence Detail element within a Lodgement or Lodgement Verification request must refer to the ELN Document ID of a Change of Ownership within the lodgement case.
An ELN Document ID in a Supporting document containing an Evidence Detail element must be unique within the request.
For each Evidence Detail, the signature must be consistent with the Evidence Detail data and the signing certificate.
The total length of a Client Document Reference element within Counterpart data must be less than or equal to 20 characters long.
For the lodgement instructions, if the Party Issued with CoRD is "None", the Specified Party of Issue and CT Direction elements must not be populated.
The set of Counterpart Signatures in the Evidence Detail must match the set of Signature values for the corresponding transfer counterparts.
The Transaction ID element of an Evidence Detail must match the Transaction ID element in the Duty assessment for the corresponding Change of Ownership Counterpart data.
A Change of Ownership document must contain one Proprietorship Of Estate Received element.

For the lodgement instructions, if the Party Issued with CoRD element is populated with "Issuing Party", the Set Of CoRD Issue Details must be populated with:
  •  a Specified Party of Issue Party Reference, and
  •  a Specified Party of Issue LR Customer Code, and
  •  CT Direction.
A party of type 'Individual', 'Partnership' or 'Sole Trader' must contain a Person Full Name element.

For a party of type 'Individual', 'Partnership' or 'Sole Trader', the Legal Entity Name of the Person Full Name element must match the constructed name elements:\n {GivenName1} ({space} {GivenNameN} - for each subsequent GivenName) ({space} {FamilyName} - if FamilyName populated)
A Notice of Statutory Charge must contain one party receiving.
A Removal of Statutory Charge must contain one party relinquishing.
For each supporting document, the supporting document type and supporting document content must match.  Supporting documents must only contain the Evidence Detail document type.

The document type / signing party role combination must be one of:
   • Convert pCT to eCT and Nominate eCT to the Lodgement Case: Consenting
   • Nominate eCT to the Lodgement Case: Consenting
   • Nominate eCT to Paper Instrument: Consenting
   • Withdrawal of Nomination: Consenting
   • Lodgement Instructions: Responsible Subscriber or Advising
   • Discharge of Mortgage: Relinquishing
   • Mortgage: Receiving
   • Withdrawal of Caveat: Relinquishing
   • Caveat: Receiving
   • Transfer: Receiving or Relinquishing
   • Notice of Acquisition: Receiving or Relinquishing
A Notice Of Acquisition Vic must contain one Details of Transaction element.
For a Change of Ownership, a Proprietor Group must contain Share Fraction element.

When assessing a name match, VOTS must trim all names prior to constructing the text used for matching to ensure each name does not contain:\n  •  a space as the first character, or \n  •  a space as the last character.

SPEAR plan details consist of:
  •  a plan number, and
  •  a SPEAR reference number, and
  •  a SPEAR lodging party value.
A SPEAR dealing is a dealing of a type in the standard code DSADT (SPEAR Dealing Types).

A subscriber party is:
  •  a subscriber in an execution, or
  •  a lodgement instructions lodging party, or
  •  an administrative notice lodging party, or
  •  an issuing party.

A party dealing is:
  •  a caveator, or
  •  a mortgagor, or
  •  a mortgagee, or
  •  a transferor, or
  •  a transferee.
If a land parcel contains the Township of Echuca (5263) and the Parish of Echuca North (2571), 'E' must be appended to the generated SPI.
If a land parcel contains the Township of Echuca (5263) and the Parish of Wharparilla (3804), 'W' must be appended to the generated SPI.

VOTS must generate a blank SPI if more than two of the following land parcel fields are populated:
  •  Lot
  •  Subdivision
  •  Portion
  •  Allotment
  •  Section
  •  Block

Prior to generating a SPI, VOTS must trim all land parcel fields to ensure each field does not contain:
  •  a space as the first character, or 
  •  a space as the last character, or
  •  a leading zero.

FirstAttribute and SecondAttribute are retrieved in preference order from:
  1  Lot
  2  Subdivision
  3  Portion
  4  Allotment
  5  Section
  6  Block
 
FirstAttribute is the first populated field.
SecondAttrribute is the next populated field after the FirstAttribute (if exists).
VOTS must generate a SPI constructed as:\n     {ParcelAttributes}{'\' if ParcelAttributes is populated}{PlanTownshipParish}
ParcelAttributes is constructed as:\n     {ParcelTypeCode - if 'RD', 'CM', 'RES'}{FirstAttribute}{'~' if SecondAttribute exists}{SecondAttribute - if exists}
PlanTownshipParish is constructed as:\n  •  For a lot plan: Plan number without the check digit\n  •  For a crown allotment: {‘PP’}{TownshipCode}{ParishCode - if TownshipCode not populated}
An overseas address must contain at least the following elements:\n   •  an Address Line containing alphanumeric characters, and\n   •  a Country Code.
VOTS must be able to calculate an electronic fee based on consideration amount
Each transferee in a Notice of Acquisition must be a represented party in an execution.
Parties other than transferee(s) and transferor(s) in a Notice of Acquisition must not be a represented party in an execution.
A transfer must contain a Notice of Acquisition.

For each transferee in a transfer:\n   •  the name must match (case insensitive) the name of a transferee in the associated Notice of Acquisition, and\n   •  if the Name Type is "Company", the ACN_ARBN_ABN must match the ACN_ARBN_ABN of the corresponding transferee in the associated Notice of Acquisition.

For each transferee in a Notice of Acquisition:\n   •  the name must match (case insensitive) the name of a transferee in the associated transfer, and\n   •  if the Name Type is "Company",  the ACN_ARBN_ABN must match the ACN_ARBN_ABN of the corresponding transferee in the associated transfer.

For each transferor in a transfer:\n   •   the name must match (case insensitive) the name of a transferor in the associated Notice of Acquisition, and\n   •  if the Name Type is "Company", must match the ACN_ARBN_ABN of the corresponding transferor in the associated Notice of Acquisition.

For each transferor in a Notice of Acquisition:\n   •   the name must match (case insensitive) the name of a transferor in the associated transfer, and\n   •  if the Name Type is "Company", must match the ACN_ARBN_ABN of the corresponding transferor in the associated transfer.
Each land parcel supplied in a Notice of Acquisition must match an active land parcel in VOTS for the referenced folio.
The construction type must not be populated for a Land Use code type of "Vacant Land".
The number of bedrooms must be 0 for a Land Use code type of "Vacant Land".
If populated, the contract date must be on or before the lodgement date.
If contract date is populated, the settlement date must be on or after the contract date.
If populated, the sale price for a property must be >= 0.
If a sale price has been populated for a property, all properties must have a sale price populated.
The total sale price must be >= 0.
If sale price(s) have been populated for property(s), the sum of the sale price for all properties must equal the total sale price.
The set of folio references in a Notice of Acquisition must match the set of folio references in the associated Transfer.
A transfer instrument must contain a Duty Transaction ID.
A transfer instrument must contain a Duty Assessment ID.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if it references folio(s) which have automated caveat(s) which:
  •  currently affect the folio(s), and
  •  could affect the caveator’s interest, and
  •  will not be withdrawn by the case, and
  •  will not be satisfied by the case.
An automated caveat is a dealing which is of a dealing type recorded for standard code ‘AUCAV’ (Automated Caveat Dealing Types).

The dealing could affect the caveator’s interest if it cannot be excluded.  The dealing will be excluded if:\n  •  the dealing type has ‘Dealing Could Affect Caveator’s Interest’ set to "No", or\n  •  the dealing type has ‘Fee Simple Dealing’ set to "Yes" and the active automated caveat has ‘Impedes Fee Simple Dealings’ set to "No".

An automated caveat will be withdrawn by the case if:\n  •  a dealing in the case is of a dealing type recorded for standard code ‘AWCAV’ (Auto Withdrawal of Caveat Dealing Types), and\n  •  the withdrawal dealing features the relevant folio reference(s) and caveat.

An automated caveat will be satisfied by the case if:
  •  a dealing in the case is of a dealing type for which ‘Dealing Could Satisfy Caveator’s Claim’ is set to "Yes", and
  •  the dealing features the relevant folio reference(s), and
  •  all caveators are included as incoming proprietors in the dealing.

A DX address must contain:
  •  DX No, and
  •  DX Location.
An overseas address must contain:\n  •  at least one line of text, and\n  •  a country.
An overseas address must not contain more than 3 lines of text where each line is a maximum of 70 characters.

A postal service address must contain:
  •  Postal Service Type, and
  •  Postal Service No, and
  •  Locality / Post Office, and
  •  State, and
  •  Postcode.

A street address must contain: 
  •  Street Name, and
  •  Locality, and
  •  State, and
  •  Postcode.
A street address with Unit No To must contain Unit No From.
A street address with Street No To must contain Street No From.
A street address must fit into 4 lines of 70 characters per line when the VOTS address presentation rules are applied (AF-9).
A text address must contain at least one line of text.
A text address must not contain more than 4 lines of text where each line is a maximum of 70 characters.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing is a street address which does not contain: 
  •  Street Name 1, or
  •  Locality, or
  •  State, or
  •  Postcode.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing contains Street Type 2 but does not contain Street Type 1.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing contains a Unit No To but does not contain Unit No From.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing contains Street No To but does not contain Street No From.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing contains Street No From Suffix but does not contain Street No From.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing contains Street No To Suffix but does not contain Street No To.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing contains Unit No From Suffix but does not contain Unit No From.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing contains Unit No To Suffix but does not contain Unit No To.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if an address supplied with the dealing does not fit into 4 lines of a maximum of 70 characters per line when the VOTS address presentation rules are applied.
PropertyNameLocationUnitValue is constructed as: \n  {PropertyName1} {space} {PropertyName2} {space} {LocationDescription} {space} {space} {UnitValue - if UnitType is populated}
UnitValue is constructed as:\n  {UnitType Display Value} {space} {UnitNoFrom} {UnitNoFromSuffix} {"-" if UnitNoTo not blank} {UnitNoTo} {UnitNoToSuffix}

UnitValue must be trimmed to ensure it does not contain:
  •  a space as the first character, or
  •  a space as the last character, or
  •  consecutive spaces.
PropertyNameLocationUnitValue must be trimmed to ensure it does not contain:\n  •  a space as the first character, or\n  •  a space as the last character.
FloorValue is constructed as:\n  {FloorType Display Value} {space} {FloorNo} {FloorNoSuffix}

FloorValue must be trimmed to ensure it does not contain:
  •  a space as the first character, or
  •  a space as the last character, or
  •  consecutive spaces.

StreetNumberAndName is constructed as:\n {UnitValue - if UnitType is blank and UnitValue is not blank} {"/" - if UnitType is blank and UnitValue is not blank} {StreetNoFrom} {StreetNoFromSuffix} {"-" if StreetNoTo not blank} {StreetNoTo} {StreetNoToSuffix} {space} {"CNR " - if StreetNoFrom is blank and StreetName2 not blank} {StreetName1} {space} {StreetType1 Display Value} {space} {StreetSuffix1 Display Value} {space} {"& " - if StreetNoFrom is blank and StreetName2 not blank} {StreetName2 - if StreetNoFrom is blank and StreetName2 not blank} {space} {StreetType2 Display Value  - if StreetNoFrom is blank and StreetName2 not blank} {space} {StreetSuffix2 Display Value - if StreetNoFrom is blank and StreetName2 not blank}

StreetNumberAndName must be trimmed to ensure it does not contain:
  •  a space as the first character, or
  •  a space as the last character, or
  •  consecutive spaces.
FloorStreetNumberName must be trimmed to ensure it does not contain:\n  •  a space as the first character, or\n  •  a space as the last character.
LocalityStatePostCode is constructed as:\n  {Locality} {space} {space} {State} {space} {space} {PostCode}

If address line 1 is longer than 70 characters, the line must be split at the last space on or before the 70th character, and the remaining characters of address line 1 are placed on address line 2 and subsequent lines are moved down.

If address line 2 is longer than 70 characters, the line must be split at the last space on or before the 70th character, and the remaining characters of address line 2 are placed on address line 3 and the subsequent line is moved down.

If address line 3 is longer than 70 characters, the line must be split at the last space on or before the 70th character, and the remaining characters of address line 3 are placed on address line 4 and the subsequent lines are moved down.
If there are more than 4 address lines or address line 4 is longer than 70 characters, the address cannot be presented.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing is:\n  •  barred from search, and/or\n  •  barred from registration.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if:
  •  a folio referenced in the dealing has a '31' dealing with a registration date >= (the current date - number of days specified in system parameter 'EELPD'), and
  •  the '31' dealing was lodged by a customer who does not have 'Exempt from Case After S31 EE Rule' set to "Yes", and
  •  the case consists of a dealing type combination that matches a combination recorded for standard code 'EECC1' or 'EECC2'.
If the consideration amount recorded on the dealing is not equal to the contract consideration amount, the dealing cannot be electronically examined and must be manually examined and registered.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing has a status of 'Cancelled'.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a current registered proprietor on a folio referenced in the dealing matches the name of a caveator in the dealing.

The registered proprietor and caveator names are constructed as:\n   •  If there are no Given Names, proprietor / caveator = Surname/Company\n   •  If there are Given Names, proprietor / caveator = Given Names {space} Surname/Company

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing has dealing(s) which:
  •  currently affect the folio, and
  •  are of a dealing type guide with 'Impede Registration' set to "Yes", and
  •  are not of a dealing type recorded for standard code ‘AUCAV’, and
  •  will not be withdrawn by the case.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing has dealing(s) which:
  •  currently affect the folio, and
  •  contain a covenant data element and covenant expiry element, and
  •  have an Expiry Date prior to today, and
  •  will not be removed by a dealing in this case.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if the dealing type has ‘Electronically Registrable’ (E-Dealing Auto Register) set to "No".
The dealing must be manually examined and registered if a folio referenced in the dealing has subsequent dealing(s) lodged which are not part of this case.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing has a free text land description.
If any folio affected by the dealing has leader dealing(s), the dealing cannot be electronically examined and must be manually examined and registered.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if 'Under Review for Examination' is set to 'Yes' for the customer who lodged the case.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing has a current proprietor who is a minor.
If any subscriber named in the dealing is flagged by LV as New, the dealing (and case) is placed in the Get Next queue for manual examination.
If a dealing in the case is of a type which has 'Offline Default' set to "Yes", the case must be assigned to the Location and Processing State specified in the dealing type.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing has:
  •  an active folio plan notation, or
  •  folio free text which contains all of the words: "AFFECT","LAND" and "HEREIN", or
  •  a current endorsement created with endorsement template code "35PA".
The request jurisdiction must be Victoria.
The referenced folio must not have a current proprietorship group recorded with free text.
VOTS must record the applicable LSS fee(s) for the date / time of the Registry Information Supply request against the Bundle Subscription.
For each LSS fee VOTS must record:\n   •  Fee Amount\n   •  Whether the fee includes GST

An LSS Bundle Type must be one of:
   •  LSS1
   •  LSS2
   •  LSS3

VOTS must record the following fees for a Registry Information Supply with Bundle Type LSS1:
   •  Registry Information Supply
   •  Title Activity Check
   •  Lodgement Verification
VOTS must record the following fees for a Registry Information Supply with Bundle Type LSS2:\n   •  Registry Information Supply\n   •  Lodgement Verification
VOTS must record the following fee for a Registry Information Supply with Bundle Type LSS3:\n   •  Registry Information Supply
VOTS must generate LSS fee invoice reports for a user specified date range.

The LSS fee invoice summary report must contain the following data:
   •  LSS bundle type
   •  Product (LSS Fee Name)
   •  Charge Code
   •  Number of units (for bundle type / product combination)
   •  Fee (Number of units * LSS Fee Amount)
   •  Fee includes GST flag

An LSS invoice data file must contain the following data:
   •  Bundle Subscription ID
   •  Date of Registry Information Supply
   •  Title Reference
   •  LSS bundle type
   •  Product (LSS Fee Name)
   •  Fee (LSS Fee Amount)
   •  Fee includes GST flag
See PR-1
See PR-14

To be considered valid for a RIS, a supplied Bundle Subscription ID must:
  •  exist in VOTS, and
  •  be associated with the land title reference supplied, and
  •  be supplied with an appropriate Bundle Type of "LSS3", and
  •  match the network origin of the Bundle Subscription ID in VOTS.
If a Bundle Subscription ID is invalid:\n  •  VOTS must not return any registry information, and\n  •  VOTS must return an error.
All registry information supply data associated with the title must be able to be mapped to appropriate NECDS data.
If registry information supply data cannot be mapped to NECDS data:\n  •  VOTS must not return any registry information , and\n  •  VOTS must return an error.
If the title has failed Land Title Reference Verification checks:\n  •  VOTS must return a land title verification report, and\n  •  VOTS must not return any registry information.

VOTS must return registry information if:
  •  the title reference has passed Land Title Reference Verification, and
  •  no Bundle Subscription ID with Bundle Type "LSS1" / "LSS2", or a valid Bundle Subscription ID with Bundle Type "LSS3" is provided, and
  •  all registry information supply data associated with the title reference can be mapped to appropriate NECDS data.
For a Bundle Type of "LSS1" / "LSS2", VOTS must create and return a Bundle Subscription ID and record the Registry Information Supply activity against the Bundle Subscription ID.
The referenced folio must not have a current proprietor recorded as an Executor / Administrator.
For a Bundle Type of "LSS3", VOTS must record the Registry Information Supply activity against the supplied Bundle Subscription ID.
If the title reference contains one address, VOTS must return the address.
If the title reference contains 0 or multiple addresses, VOTS must not return any address information.
VOTS must always return all land descriptions.
The Land Description must be composed of: \n   {Current Land Description} \n   {Unit Type - for strata and cluster plans only}

Plan of Subdivision 
  {Suburban Township Country – if Lot STC Indicator present} {Land Parcel Type} {Lot number} {"Section" – if Section Value exists} {Section Value – if exists} {"Block" – if Block Value exists} {Block Value – if exists} on Plan of Subdivision {Plan number}.   
 
  Example 1: Lot 3 on Plan of Subdivision 308572. 
  Example 2: Lot 77 Block A on Plan of Subdivision 001718. 
  Example 3: Lot 76 Section 2 on Plan of Subdivision 000906. 
  Example 4: Country Lot 44 on Plan of Subdivision 001224.

Title Plan 
  {Land Type} {Lot no} on Title Plan {Plan Number}.   
 
  Example: Lot 1 on Title Plan 813939M.

Land in Title Plan 
  Land in Title Plan {Plan Number}.   
 
  Example: Land in Title Plan 000514F.

Other Land in Title Plan 
  {Land Type} {Lot No} on Title Plan {Plan Number}. 
 
  Example 1: Reserve 1 on Title Plan 000046N.
  Example 2: Road R1 on Title Plan 023601G.

Plan of Consolidation 
  Land in Plan of Consolidation {Plan Number}.   
 
  Example: Land in Plan of Consolidation 350766X.
The referenced folio must not have a current proprietor name which contains the word "Folium" (case insensitive).

Unit on a Strata Plan 
  {Land Parcel Type} {Unit No} on Strata Plan {Plan No} and an undivided share in the common property for the time being described on the plan. 
 
  Example: Unit 3 on Strata Plan 037221Y and an undivided share in the common property for the time being described on the plan.

Other Land on Strata Plan 
  {Land Parcel Type} {Lot number} on Registered Plan of Strata Subdivision {Plan number}. 
 
  Example 1: Road R2 on Registered Plan of Strata Subdivision 020005.
  Example 2: Common Property on Registered Plan of Strata Subdivision 037411T. 
  Example 3: Reserve 1 on Registered Plan of Strata Subdivision 031056U.

Redeveloped Strata Plan 
  Lot {unit Number} on Registered Plan of Strata Subdivision {Plan number}.
 
  Example: Lot 604 on Registered Plan of Strata Subdivision 020373T.

Lot on Cluster Plan 
  {Land Parcel Type} {Lot no} on Registered Cluster Plan {Plan Number} and an undivided share in the common property for the time being described on the plan.
 
   Example: Lot 18 on Registered Cluster Plan 001504T and an undivided share in the common property for the time being described on the plan.

Redeveloped Cluster Plan 
  {Land Parcel Type} {Lot no} on Registered Cluster Plan {Plan number}. 
 
  Example: Lot 78 on Registered Cluster Plan 001134.

Other Land on a Cluster Plan 
  {Land Parcel Type} {Lot no} on Registered Cluster Plan {Plan number}.
 
  Example 1: Common Property on Registered Cluster Plan 001147.
  Example 2: Road R1 on Registered Cluster Plan 001564Y.

Current crown description: 
  {"Subdivision" if subdivision value exists} {Subdivision Value – if exists} {"Crown Allotment" if allotment value exists} {Allotment Value – if exists} {"Section" if section value exists} {Section Value – if exists} {"Block" if block value exists} {Block Value – if exists} {Other Description – if exists} {Township type description – if Township Name exists} {Township Name} {Parish Type description} {Parish Name}.
 
  Example 1: Subdivision A Crown Allotment 110 Parish of Ondit.
  Example 2: Crown Allotment 47 Parish of Tarrayoukyan.
  Example 3: Crown Allotment 8A Section D Township of Ballarat North Parish of Ballarat.
  Example 4: Crown Allotment 6A Section B Parish of Glenlogie.
  Example 5: Section 6B Block A Parish of Moolap.
  Example 6: Crown Allotment 30 Block A Parish of Chintin.
  Example 7: Portion 88 Parish of Ascot.
  Example 8: Crown Allotment 234 Section A AT EAGLEHAWK Parish of Nerring.

If free text exists for the folio, it must:
  •  be displayed after the current land description, and
  •  have leading and trailing spaces trimmed, and
  •  after trimming must not be blank.
 
  {"(Additional Information: " - if trimmed Free Text is not blank} {Trimmed Free Text - if not blank} {")"  - if trimmed Free Text is not blank}
 
  Example: Road R1 on Plan of Subdivision 124087 (Additional Information: being the land remaining untransferred in this folio).

For specific lot types on strata and cluster plans, an extra line must be shown on the land description:
 
Restricted Unit
  REGISTRATION OF DEALINGS WITH THIS {parcel type} IS RESTRICTED

                         REGISTRATION OF DEALINGS WITH THIS LOT IS RESTRICTED

  CAR PARK

                         CAR PARK

                         CAR PARK

  ACCESSORY {parcel type}
