A caveat must contain one or more Caveators.

Using the current date / time, a caveat must have a valid combination of:
   •  Statement of Claim
   •  Document Date
   •  Estate or Interest Claimed
   •  Prohibition
   •  Affected Parties / All Proprietors Affected
The caveat Document Date must not be in the future.
The Service of Notice Contact must contain an address.
For each folio referenced in a transfer, if any registered / pending proprietors are not specified as transferors, VOTS must only allow "Expert" to be specified for 'Required Case Examination'.
If the case contains part folio(s), VOTS must only allow "Expert" to be specified for 'Required Case Examination'.
Lot Type must be retrieved using standard code table LOTTY.
The referenced folio must not be barred from "search", or  "search & registration".
Land Parcel Type must be retrieved using standard code table PARTY.
STC Indicator must be retrieved using standard code table STCID.
If the supplied Bundle Subscription ID is inactive, VOTS must raise an alarm.
The referenced folio must not be a folio type of "Identified Folio".
VOTS must return a title verification report indicating whether the referenced folio is:\n  •  Eligible for electronic trading, or\n  •  Not eligible for electronic trading.
If the referenced folio is not eligible for electronic trading, VOTS must return lodgement unsuitability reason(s) within the title verification report.

When reconstructed, the Land Title Reference must conform to the format:
     XXXXX/YYYA
 
 XXXXX is the numeric volume reference.  Leading zeros are ignored. Must contain 1 – 5 digits.
 YYY is the numeric folio reference.  Leading zeroes must be shown. Must contain 3 digits.
 A is the single character suffix (optional).  Must be one of {"A","B","C","K","L"}.  Must be upper case.
The Land Title Reference must exist in VOTS as a folio reference.
See PR-1
The stored Bundle Type associated with the supplied Bundle Subscription ID must be ‘LSS1’.
To be considered valid for a Title Activity Check, a supplied Bundle Subscription ID must:\n  •  exist in VOTS\n  •  be associated with the land title reference supplied
The supplied title must pass land title verification.
VOTS must return dealings over the supplied land title reference which were lodged or their status was updated during the specified activity period.
The Activity Start Timestamp which is provided via the Title Activity Check request must be after the first ‘RIS Transmission Timestamp’ for the Bundle Subscription ID
The Activity Start Timestamp which is provided via the Title Activity Check request must not be after the date and time of receiving the request.
The activity period will start at the ‘Title Activity Start Timestamp’ of the Title Activity Check request and end on the date and time of receiving the request.

VOTS must use the Final Status Date to return dealings for the supplied Land Title Reference where the dealing status is: Registered, Completed, Withdrawn, Rejected, Abandoned, Deposited, Finished, or Approved.
VOTS must use the Lodgement Date to return dealings for the supplied Land Title Reference where the dealing status is Unregistered.
The referenced folio must not exist in the missing folio table.
The total length of all given names, including separating spaces, for a mortgagor must be less than or equal to 60 characters.
A nominate eCT to paper instrument administrative notice must contain information for the:\n  •  paper instrument, and\n  •  instrument parties.
A mortgage must contain one or more mortgagees.
Each mortgagee which is a company party type must provide an ACN or ARBN.
Parties other than the subscriber party in an execution for an instrument and the lodging party must not be the subscriber party in an execution for the lodgement instructions.

The request must only contain folios which do not have unregistered dealings which require a CT for a:
  •  Convert pCT and Nominate eCT to the Lodgement Case request, or
  •  Nominate eCT to the Lodgement Case request, or
  •  Nominate eCT to Paper Instrument request.
A certification must be unique within an execution.
The Issuing Instructions in a lodgement case must specify only one CT format.
Party signatures for Lodgement instructions must not be checked for Admin Notice requests.
All parties who sign documents must be recorded as active in VOTS and authorised electronic subscribers for the corresponding ELNO in VOTS.
For each execution, the subscriber party name and subscriber ABN must match the signature organisation name and ABN.
For each execution, the subscriber ABN must match the ABN held by VOTS.
A withdrawal of caveat instrument must specify only one caveat to be withdrawn.
For each caveat referenced in a Withdrawal of Caveat instrument, the set of caveators must match the set of caveators recorded in VOTS for the Caveat being withdrawn.
The specified caveat to be withdrawn must exist on all folios specified in the withdrawal of caveat instrument.
A caveat to be withdrawn must be of an encumbrance type that is allowed to be withdrawn by an 89W dealing as specified in the Dealing Type Guide.
A lodgement case which references whole folios only, must not withdraw the same caveat / folio combination more than once.

Each caveator featured on the withdrawal of caveat instrument must:\n   •  match (case insensitive) the recorded caveator, or\n   •  be specified with a Former Name matching (case insensitive) the recorded caveator.
Each mortgagee in a mortgage instrument must be a represented party in an execution.
Parties other than mortgagee(s) in a mortgage instrument must not be a represented party in an execution.
Each mortgagee in a discharge of mortgage instrument must be a represented party in an execution.
Parties other than mortgagee(s) in a discharge of mortgage instrument must not be a represented party in an execution.
The Lodging Party must be the subscriber party and the represented party in an execution for the Lodgement Instructions.
A party that is the subscriber party in an execution for an instrument must be the subscriber party and the represented party in an execution for the lodgement instructions.
Parties other than the subscriber party in an execution for an instrument and the lodging party must not be the represented party in an execution for the lodgement instructions.
The lodging party must represent themselves for an administrative notice.  Parties other than the requesting party in an administrative notice must not be represented.
Parties other than the requesting party in an administrative notice must not be represented.
VOTS must accept lodgements from parties as specified in the Dealing Type Guide.
Each folio reference must pass the Land Title Reference Verification checks. \n \n*For rules, refer to Land Title Reference Verification Service

If the instrument type requires a CT as per the Dealing Type Guide, then for each folio reference there must be one of these options: \n  •  an Administrative Notice dealing ("NELF" or "CNLC" dealing type) nominating the eCT to this lodgement case, or\n  •  the pCT must be nominated to this lodgement case.
Each instrument type in a lodgement case must be allowed to be lodged electronically as specified in the Dealing Type Guide.

An instrument lodged over a Restricted or Unrestricted Unit folio must also be lodged over any Accessory / Car Park Unit folio which: \n  •  has proprietorship created by the same dealing number as the Restricted or Unrestricted Unit folio, and\n  •  was created by the same plan.
An Accessory / Car Park Unit folio must not have an instrument lodged over it if no corresponding Restricted / Unrestricted Unit folio exists.

An instrument lodged over an Accessory / Car Park Unit folio must also be lodged over the corresponding Restricted or Unrestricted Unit folio which:\n  •  has proprietorship created by the same dealing number as the Accessory / Car Unit folio, and\n  •  was created by the same plan.
If the Dealing Type Guide requires that the instrument be lodged over a folio, then the instrument must have at least one folio reference.
When a lodgement case contains more than one instrument, for each instrument, at least one folio reference in the instrument must also be in another instrument.
Lodgement Instructions must specify all folio references in the Lodgement Case.
The Issuing Instructions in a lodgement case must specify only one issuing party.

Certification(s) must be:
   •  valid types for the instrument / lodgement instructions, and
   •  effective for the date / time of the first signature in the lodgement case, and
   •  the complete required set for the document / signing role combination.
The lodgement case ID / origin combination must not have been lodged in VOTS.
A lodgement case that contains an Administrative Notice must not contain any other instruments.

Operative words must be:
   •  valid types for the instrument / lodgement instructions, and
   •  effective for the date / time of the first signature in the lodgement case, and
   •  the complete required set for the instrument.
Each justification used in the lodgement case must be:\n   •  a valid type, and\n   •  effective for the date / time of the first signature in the lodgement case.
If a Justification is recorded in VOTS as requiring supporting documentation, the instrument data must indicate that the supporting documentation exists.
Multiple lodgement cases involving the same folio reference must not be processed concurrently.
A Surname/Company Name must not have more than 130 characters.
A single word within a Surname/Company Name must not have more than 76 characters.
Given Names and Surname/Company Name must not contain invalid characters (see valid character set).
A Discharge of Mortgage instrument must contain only one mortgage to be discharged.
A specified mortgage to be discharged must exist in VOTS on all folios specified in the discharge of mortgage instrument.
Mortgages to be discharged must be of an encumbrance type that is allowed to be discharged by an 84M dealing as specified in the Dealing Type Guide.
A lodgement case must not contain duplicate mortgage numbers to be discharged.
A Discharge of Mortgage always discharges the mortgage(s) from the referenced folio(s) completely.

For each mortgage in a Discharge of Mortgage instrument, the Mortgagee must:\n   •  match (case insensitive) the registered mortgagee, or\n   •  be specified with ‘Shown As’ matching (case insensitive) the registered mortgagee with a justification.

The registered mortgagee is constructed as:\n   •  If there are no Given Names, registered mortgagee = Surname/Company\n   •  If there are Given Names, registered mortgagee  = Given Names <space> Surname/Company
For each folio referenced in a Discharge of Mortgage instrument, the set of mortgagees must match (using PR-458, PR-DM-1) the set of mortgagees in VOTS.
The total length of all given names, including separating spaces, for a mortgagee must be less than or equal to 60 characters.

For each folio referenced in a Mortgage which is not preceeded by an instrument which changes proprietorship, each mortgagor must:
  •  match (case insensitive) a registered proprietor, or 
  •  be specified with ‘Shown As’ matching (case insensitive) the registered proprietor with a justification, or
  •  match (case insensitive) a party with a justification on a preceeding mortgage instrument in the same lodgement case.

The mortgagor and proprietor names are constructed as:\n   •  If there are no Given Names, mortgagor / proprietor name = Surname/Company\n   •  If there are Given Names, mortgagor / proprietor name  = Given Names <space>  Surname/Company
For each folios referenced in a Mortgage instrument, the set of mortgagors must match (using PR-462, PR-463) the set of proprietors.
A Mortgage created over more than one folio must have the same Mortgagee(s).
The Mortgage date must not be later than the lodgement date.
A mortgage which is preceded by a 74D mortgage within the same Lodgement Case must have mortgagor(s) who is(are) the same as the mortgagors(s) specified in the 74D mortgage instrument.
Lodgement instructions must not be populated to VOTS for Admin Notice requests.

If the eCT was nominated to the lodgement case and Issuing Instructions exist in the Lodgement Instructions, VOTS must validate that the CT is being issued in the following order of precedence:
   1  The first mortgagee’s subscriber if the first mortgagee (after lodgement case registration) is a party in an instrument in the lodgement case.
   2  The proprietor’s subscriber if the proprietor (after lodgement case registration) is a party in an instrument in the lodgement case. 
   3  The subscriber who nominated the CT to the Lodgement Case.
Any CT issued from a lodgement case must be issued to a party that is active in VOTS and authorised to transact electronically for the corresponding ELNO in VOTS.
Each folio reference in the issuing instructions must be present in an instrument in the lodgement case.

If the CT was nominated to the lodgement case and there are no issuing instructions for a CT, one of the following must be true:\n   •  the pCT has been nominated to the lodgement case with a ‘Stay’ option, or\n   •  the eCT has been nominated to the lodgement case with a ‘Stay’ option.

If the CT was nominated to the lodgement case and there are issuing instructions for a CT, one of the following must be true:\n   •  the pCT has been nominated to the lodgement case with a ‘Go’ option, or\n   •  the eCT has been nominated to the lodgement case with a ‘Go’ option.
Each Dealing Requirement must be:\n   •  a valid type, and\n   •  effective for the date / time of the first signature in the lodgement case.
If a Dealing Requirement is recorded in VOTS as requiring supporting documentation, the lodgement instructions data must indicate that the supporting documentation is required.
The Folio Reference(s) must relate to pCT(s) for a Convert pCT and Nominate eCT to the Lodgement Case request.
The Folio Reference(s) must relate to eCT(s) for a:\n  •  Nominate eCT to the Lodgement Case request, or\n  •  Nominate eCT to Paper Instrument request.
An eCT can not be nominated if it is already nominated to a lodgement case or paper instrument.
All eCTs specified in a nomination request:\n  •  must have the same eCT Control, and\n  •  the eCT Control must be the lodging party specified in the Admin Notice.
pCT(s) cannot be converted if they are currently in the made available system.
All CT(s) cited in the Withdrawal of Nomination request must be eCT(s).
All eCT(s) cited in the Withdrawal of Nomination request must:\n   •  have the same eCT control, and\n   •  the eCT Control must be the lodging party specified in the Admin Notice.
A Withdrawal of Nomination request can only reference eCTs which are currently:\n   •  nominated to a lodgement case, or\n   •  nominated to a paper instrument.
All fees must be calculated and displayed in Australian dollars.
Fees must be calculated using the effective fees for the supplied lodgement date.
Fees must not be calculated if a fee does not exist for the financial year of the lodgement date.
Fee calculation must only use fees marked as electronic (with the exception of the Made Available fee).
Made Available fee(s) must be calculated using the generic Made Available fee type.
The fee calculation process must calculate individual fee(s) applicable to each instrument in the lodgement case.
VOTS must return fee details if fees can be calculated.
Supplied and calculated fees must be identical.
When Bundle Subscription ID(s) are supplied, completed lodgement verifications must be recorded against the Bundle Subscription ID(s).
When sending the lodgement verification status advice, VOTS must raise an alarm if the ELNO acknowledgement response is not "0 OK".

If the pCT was nominated to the lodgement case and Issuing Instructions exist in the Lodgement Instructions, VOTS must validate that the CT is being issued in the following order of precedence:\n   1  The first mortgagee’s subscriber if the first mortgagee (after lodgement case registration) is a party in an instrument in the lodgement case.\n   2  The proprietor’s subscriber if the proprietor (after lodgement case registration) is a party in an instrument in the lodgement case.

When an MCP number is supplied with a mortgage the MCP number must conform to the format AANNNN where:
   •  "AA" is always the number prefix, and
   •  NNNN are digits from 1 – 9999 (leading zeros may or may not be present), and
   •  NNNN is less than or equal to the last MCP number allocated.
Fees must be able to be calculated.
The referenced folio must be:\n  •  Freehold and fee simple, or\n  •  Crown grant and fee simple.
The referenced folio must not have a status of "Cancelled".
Jurisdiction must be Victoria
VOTS must execute all lodgement verification rules prior to creating a lodgement.
VOTS must return a "Not Accepted" call-back response when a Lodgement Case fails lodgement verification.
The Lodgement Case must be saved in VOTS when it has passed Lodgement Verification.
VOTS must allow the generation of the following reports for the Lodgement Case:\n  •  Electronic instrument enquiry, and\n  •  Electronic Lodgement Case signature report.
VOTS must create a lodgement from a Lodgement Case with:\n  •  a lodgement status of "Closed"’, and\n  •  a lodgement type of "EC Electronic".
Each instrument in the Lodgement Case must be created as an electronically lodged dealing in VOTS.
A Discharge of Mortgage instrument must create an 84M dealing.
A Mortgage instrument which does not contain any justifications must create a 74 dealing.
A Mortgage instrument which contains justification(s) must create a 74D dealing.
A Convert pCT and Nominate to Lodgement Case administrative notice must create a CNLC dealing.
A Nominate eCT to Lodgement Case administrative notice must create a NELF dealing.
A Nominate eCT to Paper Instrument administrative Notice must create a NPAP dealing.
A Withdrawal of Nomination administrative notice must create a NREM dealing.
For each CT nominated to the lodgement case, the lodgement of the first dealing in that lodgement case referencing the CT will remove the nomination from the corresponding folio.
A bundle subscription ID must be set to inactive if it is associated with a folio reference in a dealing of a type which expires a bundle subscription ID as specified in the dealing type guide.
If the lodgement contains dealing(s) which affect proprietorship or encumbrance(s), VOTS must return a "Lodged" call-back response when the lodgement and dealing(s) have been created.
The lodgement must be queued for manual processing if it requires:\n  •  supporting documents for dealing requirement(s), or\n  •  supporting documents for justification(s).
The lodgement must be queued for manual processing if any dealing is a type which requires offline processing as specified in the dealing type guide.

The lodgement must be queued for Electronic Examination when:\n  •  it does not require supporting documents, and\n  •  it does not contain dealing(s) of a type which requires offline processing as specified in the dealing type guide.

If a dealing in the lodgement does not meet the EC examination rule for the dealing type as specified in the Electronic Examination Guide:\n  •  the dealing(s) must remain at "Unregistered" status, and\n  •  the lodgement must be queued for manual processing.
All lodgement dealings must be automatically registered if every dealing in the lodgement meets the EC examination rules for the dealing type as specified in the Electronic Examination Guide.
VOTS must return a "Completed" call-back response when all dealings in the lodgement have reached a status other than "Unregistered".
Completed lodgements must be recorded against the supplied Bundle Subscription ID(s).
When sending the lodgement case status advice, VOTS must raise an alarm if the ELNO acknowledgement response is not "0 OK".
The lodgement must be queued for manual processing if the lodging party is under review for electronic examination.
VOTS must save all lodgement and dealing information in upper case.
The proprietor's address must be retained when a dealing that contains a justification for a proprietor is registered.
The referenced folio must not be a Skeleton folio.
The referenced folio must not have a current proprietorship group recorded as a NICO.
Text summary stylesheets must be able to generate a text summary which excludes elements which vary between counterparts.
An individual line on a text summary must not exceed 80 characters.
When a line of text exceeds 80 characters, a line break must be inserted at the last space prior to the 81st character.
A counterpart execution with a single empty certification statement element must be processed as having no certifications.
The referenced folio must not have a current proprietor who is a minor.
The request jurisdiction must be Victoria.
The Fee Period Start Timestamp must not be greater than the date on which the Fee Forwarding Advice was received at Land Victoria.
The Fee Period End Timestamp must not be greater than the date on which the Fee Forwarding Advice was received at Land Victoria.
The Fee Period Start Timestamp must be less than the Fee Period End Timestamp.
An LR lodgement reference for an invoice payment must correspond to an existing unpaid closed Lodgement lodged via PEXA within VOTS.
An LR lodgement reference for a dishonour must correspond to an existing paid Lodgement lodged via PEXA within VOTS.
An LR Customer Code in the request must be the lodging party of the corresponding LV lodgement.
The LR Invoice Total Amount in the request must equal the total fees payable for the corresponding LV lodgement within VOTS.
The Payment Total Amount must equal:\n   (Sum of LR Invoice Total Amounts for Payments) - (Sum of LV Invoice Total Amounts for Dishonours)
A receipt record must be created for each lodgement fee received from the PEXA Fee Forwarding Advice and lodged in cash drawer 70.
The amount paid for the relevant closed lodgement record in VOTS must be updated with the LR Invoice Amount received from PEXA Fee Forwarding advice.
The status of the receipt record created for each lodgement fee received from PEXA Fee Forwarding Advice must be "Created".
The receipt created for each lodgement fee received from PEXA Fee Forwarding Advice must not be printed.

The receipt record must contain the following data:
  •  LR Lodgement Reference
  •  LR Customer Code
  •  ELN payment reference number
  •  Invoice total amount
  •  Date receipt created
The Direct Credit payment mode must be used for payments for PEXA lodgements.
Dishonoured payments received from a PEXA fee forwarding advice must not be recorded against cash drawer 70.

A dishonoured fee must be recorded against the LV Lodgement Fee Receipt record corresponding to the dishonoured ELN Lodgement Case by:\n  •  setting the receipt status to "Dishonoured", and\n  •  recording a Dishonoured Date.

The Dishonoured Fees report must contain the following information:
  •  VOTS Receipt Number
  •  Lodgement Number
  •  Customer Code
  •  Customer Name
  •  Receipt Amount.
The dishonour email address must be configurable using the VOTS system parameter DISHONOUR_EMAIL.
The Direct Credit payment mode must not be available as a payment mode within the Receipt Maintenance Function in the VOTS client.
Users must not have the ability to use the Receipt Maintenance function in VOTS to pay for unpaid PEXA lodgements.
Cash drawer 70 must be read only in the Cash Drawer Assignment Maintenance window in the VOTS Client.
The VOTS Client Void Receipt function must not be able to void PEXA receipts.
The content of cash drawer 70 must be included in the nightly Oracle Financial data extract.
Cash drawer 70 must be automatically closed and re-opened at 4.05pm every weekday.
The open assignment for cash drawer 70 must be retrieved using the assignment which does not have an end date & time.
The open cash drawer 70 assignment must be closed by setting the end date and time to the processing date and time.
The Assignment Total Amount must be calculated by summing all the Amounts Received for receipts for the assignment.

The Cash Drawer Takings record must be created with:
  •  Assignment: Retrieved cash drawer 70 assignment
  •  System Amount: Assignment Total Amount
  •  Actual Amount: Assignment Total Amount
  •  Payment Mode: Direct Credit

The new cash drawer 70 assignment must be created with:
  •  Cash Drawer: 70
  •  Registration officer: "PEXA Payment Receipting Registration Officer"
  •  Cash Float: 0
  •  Assignment Start Date: Processing Date
  •  Assignment Start Time: Processing Time
  •  Assignment End Date: Empty
  •  Assignment End Time: Empty
The request jurisdiction must be Victoria.
The Lodgement Correspondence Address must be a postal address.
The supplied ABN must match the customer ABN in VOTS.
If a request fails validation a message failure error must be returned.
For a Create request, VOTS must create a new customer:\n   •  associated with the supplied ELN subscriber ID, and\n   •  authorised to transact from PEXA.

If the LV Customer Code is not associated with the PEXA ELN subscriber ID, VOTS must:\n   •  associate the VOTS Customer with the supplied PEXA ELN subscriber ID, and\n   •  authorise the VOTS Customer to transact with PEXA.
The VOTS Customer Pick Up Address must be updated using the LR Delivery address if supplied.
The VOTS Customer Pick Up Address must be removed if the LR Delivery address is not supplied.
The VOTS Customer Correspondence Address must be updated using the Lodgement Correspondence address.
The VOTS Customer Registered Business Address must be updated to the supplied Registered Business address.
The VOTS Customer preferred address must be set to:\n   •  Pick Up Address (if exists), or\n   •  Correspondence Address (if Pick Up Address does not exist).
Customer data in the request must not exceed the relevant VOTS field lengths.

The document delivery method must be set to:
   •  Pick up if Pick Up Address exists, or
   •  Post if Pick Up Address does not exist and Correspondence Address is a postal address, or
   •  DX if Pick Up Address does not exist and Correspondence Address is a DX address.
The VOTS Customer Name must be updated using (in preference order):\n    1. the Business Name (if supplied), or\n    2. the Legal Entity Name (if the business name is not supplied).
A create request must record the 'create user' and 'update user' as PEXA in the customer audit information.
An update request must record the 'update user' as PEXA in the customer audit information.
A customer update request for a customer under review must generate an alarm.
The VOTS Client must not allow editing of the data provided in the PEXA subscription tab.
VOTS must save all customer data in upper case.
The customer update request action must be:\n   •  Create, or\n   •  Update.
The LV Customer Code must not be populated for a Create request.
The LV Customer Code must be populated for an Update request.
The LV Customer Code must exist in VOTS.
The LV Customer Code must be active in VOTS.
If the PEXA ELN Subscriber ID is associated with the LV Customer Code, the subscriber must be authorised to transact from PEXA.
The LV Customer Code must not be associated with a different PEXA ELN Subscriber ID in VOTS.
An LR lodgement reference / Payment type combination must not exist more than once in the request.

Each LR lodgement reference for a dishonour must correspond to:\n  •  an existing paid Lodgement lodged via PEXA within VOTS, or\n  •  an LR lodgement reference for an invoice payment within the request.

VOTS must process all payments prior to processing dishonours*.\n \n*In a case where a payment and its dishonour are received in the same request, this will ensure that both the receipt and the dishonour are created correctly.
VOTS must trim all textual lodgement and dealing information data before saving to ensure it does not contain:\n  •  a space as the first character, or\n  •  a space as the last character.
A Caveat instrument must create an 89 dealing.
A Transfer instrument with a monetary consideration must create a 45 dealing.
A Transfer instrument with a non-monetary consideration must create a 45NM dealing.
A Withdrawal of Caveat instrument must create an 89W dealing.

The referenced folio must not have:
  •  an active folio plan notation, or
  •  folio free text which contains all the words: "AFFECT","LAND" and "HEREIN", or
  •  a current endorsement created with endorsement template code "35PA".

If the folio referenced is a Restricted folio, an Accessory / Car Park folio must exist which:\n  •  has proprietorship created by the same dealing number as the Restricted folio, and\n  •  was created by the same plan.

If the folio referenced is an Accessory / Car Park folio, a Restricted / Unrestricted folio must exist which:\n  •  has proprietorship created by the same dealing number as the Accessory / Car Park folio, and\n  •  was created by the same plan.
pCT(s) cannot be converted if the CT is currently in the print queue.
Each Caveator in a caveat instrument must be a represented party in an execution.
Parties other than Caveator(s) in a caveat instrument must not be a represented party in an execution.
A caveat must contain one or more Caveators.
A caveat must contain one or more folio references.

Using the date / time of the first signature in the lodgement case as the effective date, a caveat must have a valid combination of:
   •  Statement of Claim
   •  Document Date
   •  Estate or Interest Claimed
   •  Prohibition
   •  Affected Parties / All Proprietors Affected
For each execution for a caveat instrument, the caveat Document Date must not be later than the signing date.
The Service of Notice Contact Surname / company name must not be blank.
The Service of Notice Contact must contain an address.

If the instrument type does not require a CT as per the Dealing Type Guide, then for each folio reference there can be one of these options:\n  •  an Administrative Notice dealing ("NELF" or "CNLC" dealing type) nominating the eCT to this lodgement case, or\n  •  the pCT must be nominated to this lodgement case.

An instrument lodged over a Restricted / Unrestricted / Accessory / Car Park folio must also be lodged over all Restricted / Unrestricted / Accessory / Car Park folios which:\n  •  have proprietorship created by the same dealing number as the referenced folio, and\n  •  were created by the same plan.

For a party of type 'Company', VOTS must populate AbbreviatedCompanyName by:\n  •  trimming SurnameCompany to ensure it does not contain a space as the first character or a space as the last character, then \n  •  applying the transformations in the Company Name Abbreviation table where the Company Name includes at least one word prefixing the text to be converted.
The total length of all given names, including separating spaces, must be less than or equal to 60 characters.

A party of type 'Company' must contain an ACN or ARBN if it is:
  •  a caveator, or
  •  a mortgagor, or
  •  a mortgagee, or
  •  a new proprietor.
The Surname/Company Name for a government party must exist in VOTS as a government proprietor type name.

A supplied ACN / ARBN must conform to the following rules:
   •  it must have 9 digits, and
   •  the 9th digit must be the valid check digit.
 
 The check digit (9th digit) is calculated using the following procedure:
  1.  remove any spaces
  2.  apply a weighting to the first 8 digits:
        - 1st digit * 8
        - 2nd digit * 7
        - 3rd digit * 6
        - 4th digit * 5
        - 5th digit * 4
        - 6th digit * 3
        - 7th digit * 2
        - 8th digit * 1
    3.  total weighted value = sum of digit weighted values 
    4.  remainder  = total weighted value Modulus 10
    5.  check digit = 10 - remainder value

A street address must contain at least the following elements:
   •  Street Name 1, and
   •  Locality, and
   •  State, and
   •  Post Code.
A street address containing Street Type 2 must also contain Street Type 1.

When a lodgement case contains more than one instrument, all instruments must be connected.  
 
To determine whether all instruments are connected, the following procedure is followed:
  1. Mark the 1st instrument as 'connected' and use instrument in step 2
  2. Using the supplied instrument(s), for each folio reference retrieve all instruments which use the folio reference and are not marked as ‘connected’
     2a. Mark retrieved instrument(s) 'connected' and use in step 2
  3. When step 2 has completed, compare the list of 'connected' instruments with the list of all instruments in the case.  If the list of 'connected' instruments = list of all instruments in a case then
         All instruments are connected
     Else
         Instruments are not connected

When assessing a mortgagee name match, VOTS must trim all names prior to constructing the text used for matching to ensure each name does not contain:\n  •  a space as the first character, or \n  •  a space as the last character.

AbbreviatedCompanyVal is constructed by:\n  •  trimming {SurnameCompany} to ensure it does not contain a space as the first character or a space as the last character, then \n  •  applying the transformations in the Company Name Abbreviation table.

For each mortgage referenced in a Discharge of Mortgage instrument, the set of mortgagees must match (using PR-458, PR-LVCV-23, PR-LVDM-2, PR-LVCV-24) the set of mortgagees registered in VOTS for the mortgage being discharged.
If the CT was not nominated to the lodgement case, there must not be issuing instructions for the CT.

A party that is the subscriber party in an execution for an instrument must be the subscriber party and the represented party in an execution for the lodgement instructions with the corresponding transacting party role:
   •  represents caveator in a caveat instrument:  'Incoming Caveator' role
   •  represents caveator in a withdrawal caveat instrument:  'Outgoing Caveator' role
   •  represents mortgagee in a mortgage instrument:  'Incoming Mortgagee' role
   •  represents mortgagee in a discharge of mortgage instrument:  'Outgoing Mortgagee' role
   •  represents transferee in a transfer instrument:  'Transferee' role
   •  represents transferor in a transfer instrument:  'Transferor' role

A party that is the subscriber party in an execution for the lodgement instructions must be the  subscriber party in an execution in an instrument with the corresponding instrument / represented party combination:
   •  Incoming Caveator: represents caveator in a caveat instrument
   •  Outgoing Caveator: represents caveator in a withdrawal caveat instrument
   •  Incoming Mortgagee: represents mortgagee in a mortgage instrument
   •  Outgoing Mortgagee: represents mortgagee in a discharge of mortgage instrument
   •  Transferee: represents transferee in a transfer instrument
   •  Transferor: represents transferor in a transfer instrument
Parties other than a subscriber party in an execution for an instrument must not be the subscriber party in an execution for the lodgement instructions.
Parties other than a subscriber party in an execution for an instrument must not be the represented party in an execution for the lodgement instructions.

When assessing a mortgagor / proprietor name match, VOTS must trim all names prior to constructing the text used for matching to ensure each name does not contain:\n  •  a space as the first character, or \n  •  a space as the last character.

AbbreviatedCompanyVal is constructed by:\n  •  trimming {SurnameCompany} to ensure it does not contain a space as the first character or a space as the last character, then \n  •  applying the transformations in the Company Name Abbreviation table where the Company Name includes at least one word prefixing the text to be converted.
For each folio referenced in a mortgage instrument, the set of mortgagors must match (using PR-LVCV-23, PR-LVCV-24, PR-LVMO-2, PR-LVMO-6, PR-LVMO-7) the set of registered/pending proprietors.

For each folio referenced in a Mortgage not preceded by an instrument in the Lodgement Case which changes proprietorship, each mortgagor must:\n  •  match (case insensitive) a registered proprietor, or \n  •  be specified with ‘Shown As’ matching (case insensitive) the registered proprietor with a justification.
For each folio referenced in a Mortgage preceded by an instrument in the Lodgement Case which changes the proprietorship, each mortgagor must match (case insensitive) a pending proprietor.
Each caveator in a withdrawal of caveat instrument must be a represented party in an execution.
Parties other than caveator(s) in a withdrawal of caveat instrument must not be a represented party in an execution.
Each transferor in a transfer instrument must be a represented party in an execution.

For each folio referenced in a transfer instrument, the set of transferors must match (using PR-LVTR-7, PR-LVTR-8, PR-LVCV-23, PR-LVCV-24, PR-LVMO-2, PR-LVCV-11) the set of registered/pending proprietors.
If an MCP number is populated for a transfer:\n   •  the MCP number must be a registered dealing in VOTS, and\n   •  the dealing type must be "MCP".
If the MCP Expiry date is populated for a transfer, the MCP number must also be populated.
An MCP Expiry date must be later than the Lodgement Date.
If the Folio Manner of Holding is "Sole Proprietor":\n   •  there must be only one new Proprietor Group, and\n   •  there must be only one new Proprietor.
If the Folio Manner of Holding is "Joint Proprietors":\n   •  there must be only one new Proprietor Group, and\n   •  there must be more than one new Proprietor.
If the Folio Manner of Holding is "Tenants In Common" there must be more than one new Proprietor Group.
Each new Proprietor in a transfer instrument must be a represented party in an execution.
If the Manner of Holding is "Sole Proprietor" for a new Proprietor Group, there must be only one new Proprietor.
If the Manner of Holding is "Joint Proprietors" for a new Proprietor Group, there must be more than one new Proprietor.
For each folio referenced in a transfer, the total of share portions for new proprietor groups must equal the total of share portions for registered proprietor groups.
The Estate and Interest must be "Fee Simple".
A Service Of Notice Address must be supplied for each New Proprietor.
Parties other than transferor(s) or new Proprietor(s) in a transfer instrument must not be a represented party in an execution.
A transfer must contain one or more transferor(s).
A transfer must contain one or more new Proprietor(s).
A transfer must contain one or more folio reference(s).

For each folio referenced in a transfer which is the first instrument in the Lodgement Case to change proprietorship, each transferor must:
   •  match (case insensitive) a registered proprietor, or 
   •  be specified with ‘Shown As’ matching (case insensitive) the registered proprietor with a justification.
 
* Instruments that can change proprietorship include Transfers and instruments that contain a justification.

For each folio referenced in a transfer preceded by an instrument in the Lodgement Case which changes proprietorship, each transferor must match (case insensitive) a pending proprietor from the preceding instrument.

When assessing a proprietor name match, VOTS must trim all names prior to constructing the text used for matching to ensure each name does not contain:\n  •  a space as the first character, or \n  •  a space as the last character.
A withdrawal of caveat instrument must specify only one caveat to be withdrawn.

When assessing a caveator name match, VOTS must trim all names prior to constructing the text used for matching to ensure each name does not contain:\n  •  a space as the first character, or \n  •  a space as the last character.

AbbreviatedCompanyVal is constructed by:\n  •  trimming {SurnameCompany} to ensure it does not contain a space as the first character or a space as the last character, then \n  •  applying the transformations in the Company Name Abbreviation table.

For each caveat referenced in a Withdrawal of Caveat instrument, the set of caveators must match (using PR-LVWC-5, PR-LVCV-23, PR-LVCV-24, PR-LVWC-11) the set of caveators recorded in VOTS for the Caveat being withdrawn.
The specified caveat to be withdrawn must exist in VOTS on all folios specified in the withdrawal of caveat instrument.
A caveat to be withdrawn must be of an encumbrance type that is allowed to be withdrawn by an 89W dealing as specified in the Dealing Type Guide.
A lodgement case must not withdraw the same caveat more than once.

Each caveator featured on the withdrawal of caveat instrument must:\n   •  match (case insensitive) the recorded caveator, or\n   •  be specified with ‘Shown As’ matching (case insensitive) the recorded caveator with a justification.
For each folio referenced in a Withdrawal of Caveat instrument, the total number of caveators must match the total number of caveators recorded in VOTS for the Caveat being withdrawn.
The caveator name is constructed as:\n   •  If there are no Given Names, caveator = Surname/Company\n   •  If there are Given Names, caveator  = Given Names <space>  Surname/Company
A Withdrawal of Caveat always withdraws the caveat from the referenced folios completely.
For each caveat referenced in a Withdrawal of Caveat instrument, the set of caveators must match (using PR-LVWC-5, PR-LVWC-7) the set of caveators recorded in VOTS for the Caveat being withdrawn.
If any folio affected by the dealing has a restricted, car park or accessory unit the dealing cannot be examined and must be placed in the Get Next queue.
If the case requires supporting documents, the case must be assigned to:\n  •  Location: Spec Regn\n  •  Processing State: Supporting Documents

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if 'Customer Active' is set to "No" or 'Authorised to Transact with PEXA' is set to "No" for:
  •  the customer (subscriber) who lodged the case, or
  •  a customer (subscriber) who signed the related instrument, or
  •  a customer (subscriber) who will be issued a CT from the dealing.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if 'Under Review for Examination' is set to 'Yes' for:
  •  the customer (subscriber) who lodged the case, or
  •  a customer (subscriber) who signed the related instrument, or
  •  a customer (subscriber) who will be issued a CT from the dealing.

If any current proprietor being transferred from any folio affected by the dealing is a Company AND the consideration amount exceeds the value configured in the EECON system parameter, the dealing cannot be electronically examined and must be manually examined and registered.

If any folio affected by the dealing has a current endorsement for a dealing of the type defined in Parameter 1, the dealing cannot be electronically examined and must be manually examined and registered.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a proprietor or an encumbrance party:\n  •  contains a word from standard code 'PTYRW' (Party Restricted Words) within the party name, and\n  •  does not have an ACN or ARBN.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing is a Restricted / Unrestricted / Accessory / Car Park folio and the dealing does not reference all folios which: 
  •  are Restricted / Unrestricted / Accessory / Car Park folios, and
  •  have proprietorship created by the same dealing number as the referenced folio, and
  •  were created by the same plan.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing is a Restricted folio and no Accessory / Car Park folio exists in VOTS which:\n  •  has proprietorship created by the same dealing number as the Restricted folio, and\n  •  was created by the same plan.

The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing is an Accessory / Car Park folio and no Restricted / Unrestricted folio exists in VOTS which:\n  •  has proprietorship created by the same dealing number as the Accessory / Car Park folio, and\n  •  was created by the same plan.
The dealing must be moved to the manual queue if a folio referenced in the dealing has unregistered dealing(s) which are not part of this case.
The Duty Transaction ID must not have been recorded for a PEXA dealing lodged in VOTS.
VOTS must send a SPEAR dealing status announcement when a SPEAR dealing is lodged.
VOTS must send a SPEAR dealing status announcement when the status changes for a SPEAR dealing.
VOTS must send a SPEAR dealing status announcement for a SPEAR dealing when the processing state code is set to 'STOP' (Stopped).
VOTS must send a Landata interested land announcement when a dealing of a type in the standard code LDFSD (LANDATA Folio SPI Dealing Types) is lodged.
VOTS must send a made available announcement when a CT with a folio reference recorded as an interested folio is made available.
VOTS must send a made available announcement when a made available CT with a folio reference recorded as an interested folio is used in a dealing.
VOTS must send a made available announcement when a made available CT with a folio reference recorded as an interested folio is removed from made available.

When generating a notice, VOTS must remove the dealing controlling party as a notice addressee if:\n  •  the notice template has 'Suppress notice for SPEAR lodging party' = 'Yes', and \n  •  the lodging party for the dealing is a SPEAR lodging party.

When generating a notice, VOTS must remove a notice addressee if:
  •  the notice template has 'Suppress notice for SPEAR lodging party' = 'Yes', and 
  •  the lodging party for the dealing is a SPEAR lodging party, and
  •  the addressee has the same customer code as the lodging party.
VOTS must record SPEAR plan details when:\n  •  a SPEAR plan notification is received, and\n  •  VOTS has not previously recorded the SPEAR plan.
VOTS must update the SPEAR plan details record when:\n  •  a SPEAR plan notification is received, and\n  •  VOTS has already recorded the SPEAR plan.
VOTS must remove the SPEAR plan details record when:\n  •  a SPEAR plan removal notification is received, and\n  •  the plan number has not been lodged as a dealing.
When a SPEAR dealing is lodged for a plan number with SPEAR plan details, VOTS must set the lodgement 'SPEAR lodging party' to the value recorded in the SPEAR plan details record.

VOTS must set the lodgement 'SPEAR lodging party' to the value in SPEAR plan notification when:\n  •  a SPEAR plan notification is received, and\n  •  the plan number has already been lodged as a dealing.
VOTS must set the lodgement 'SPEAR lodging party' to "No" when:\n  •  a SPEAR plan removal notification is received, and\n  •  the plan number has already been lodged as a dealing.
VOTS must send a SPEAR dealing status announcement for a SPEAR dealing when the processing state code changes from 'STOP' (Stopped).
VOTS must set the lodgement 'SPEAR lodging party' to 'No' for a new lodgement.
Each transferor in a Notice of Acquisition must be a represented party in an execution.
A party dealing must have an Electronic Party Type of 'Organisation' or 'Individual'.
A subscriber party must have an Electronic Party Type of 'Sole Trader', 'Partnership' or 'Organisation'.
A party dealing with an Electronic Organisation Type of 'Registered Company' or 'Registered Company in External Administration' must have an ACN.
A party dealing with an Electronic Organisation Type of 'Registered Australian body or foreign company' must have an ARBN.
A party with an Electronic Party Type of 'Sole Trader', 'Partnership' or 'Individual' must not have an ACN or ARBN.
A party with an Electronic Party Type of 'Organisation' must have an Electronic Organisation Type.
A party with an Electronic Organisation Type of 'Registered company in external administration' must have one or two Administration Status value(s).
A party with Administration Status value(s) must have an Electronic Organisation Type of 'Registered company in external administration'.
Administration Status values must be unique within a party.
For each party, VOTS must populate VOTS Party Type by applying the translations in the Electronic to VOTS Party Type table.
VOTS must aggregate document compliance errors to ensure each Eln Document Id is unique within the Document Compliance element of the Lodgement Compliance Report structure.
For each folio referenced in a transfer instrument, if the set of transferors does not match the set of registered/pending proprietors, VOTS must generate a warning.
If the case contains part folio(s), VOTS must generate a warning.
If the Service of Notice Contact address contains four lines, the fourth line must not exceed 70 characters in length.
If the date of the Activity Start Timestamp in a Title Activity Check request is earlier than 60 days before the first RIS transmission date for the Bundle Subscription ID, VOTS must raise an alarm.
A statutory charge instrument must contain one or more folio references.

A party dealing is:
  •  a caveator, or
  •  a mortgagor, or
  •  a mortgagee, or
  •  a transferor (excluding a NOA transferor), or
  •  a transferee (excluding a NOA transferee), or 
  •  an applicant.
A lodgement case which contains a Statutory Charge instrument must not contain any other instruments.
A statutory charge instrument must have a valid combination of:\n    •  legislation\n    •  applicant
A local government body name is:\n   •  recorded in VOTS as a municipality, and\n   •  recorded as active.

A statutory charge instrument must have a valid combination of:
    •  legislation
    •  liability value
    •  liability statement
A statutory charge instrument applicant must have:\n    •  a street address, or \n    •  an overseas address.
A removal of statutory charge instrument must contain one or more folio references.
A removal of statutory charge instrument applicant must have:\n    •  a street address, or \n    •  an overseas address.

Each statutory charge specified in a removal of statutory charge instrument must be of dealing type:
    •  FHOG, or
    •  LTC, or
    •  RVC, or
    •  LGHC, or
    •  GAICC.

For each statutory charge specified in a removal of statutory charge instrument, the applicant must:\n   •  match (case insensitive) the recorded applicant, or\n   •  be specified with ‘Shown As’ matching (case insensitive) the recorded applicant with a justification.
A lodgement case must not remove the same statutory charge / folio combination more than once.
The specified statutory charge(s) to be removed must exist in VOTS on all folios featured in the removal of statutory charge instrument.
The statutory charge(s) specified in a removal of statutory charge instrument must be of one dealing type.
The applicant in a statutory charge instrument must be a represented party in an execution.
The applicant in a removal of statutory charge instrument must be a represented party in an execution.
